holidays.name: National Sugar Cookie Day
holidays.description: A sweet day dedicated to celebrating the simple yet delicious sugar cookie. This day is perfect for baking, decorating, and sharing sugar cookies with friends and family.
holidays.origin: The exact origin is unclear, but it is believed to have started as a fun way to honor the classic sugar cookie, a staple in American baking traditions.
holidays.funFact: Sugar cookies have been around since at least the 1700s and were originally created as a holiday treat because the simple ingredients were easy to store over winter.

holidays.name: Gulliver's Day
holidays.description: A quirky day celebrating the adventures of Lemuel Gulliver, the fictional protagonist of Jonathan Swift's satirical classic, 'Gulliver's Travels.' Fans of literature and satire mark the day with readings or themed parties.
holidays.origin: Named after Gulliver's Travels, published in 1726, this day recognizes the enduring impact of Swift's social commentary through fantasy and adventure.
